title: Slow Cooker Beef Stew Recipe
description: This beef stew recipe is easy to make in a slow cooker with potatoes, carrots, celery, broth, herbs, and spices for a hearty and comforting dinner.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Soups, Stews and Chili Recipes Stews Beef Slow Cooker Beef Stew 4.5 (5,467) 4,018 Reviews 434 Photos This easy slow cooker beef stew recipe made with potatoes, carrots, celery, broth, herbs, and spices is hearty and comforting. You won't be slow to say 'yum'! Submitted by BUCHKO Updated on September 23, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 434 434 434 434 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 4 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 20 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 pounds beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch pieces ¼ cup all-purpose flour ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon ground black pepper 1 ½ cups beef broth 4 medium carrots, sliced 3 medium potatoes, diced 1 medium onion, chopped 1 stalk celery, chopped 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon ground paprika 1 clove garlic, minced 1 large bay leaf Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place beef in the slow cooker. Mix flour, salt, and pepper together in a small bowl; pour over beef and stir until coated. Add beef broth, carrots, potatoes, onion, celery, Worcestershire sauce, paprika, garlic, and bay leave; stir to combine. Cover, and cook until beef is tender enough to cut with a spoon, on Low for 8 to 12 hours, or on High for 4 to 6 hours. Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS From the Editor This original recipe submission called for slow cooking on Low for 10 to 12 hours. When making the video for this recipe, our food stylists found a cook time of 8 hours on Low (or 4 hours on High) was sufficient. Please stir and check doneness along the way to be sure your meat is cooked properly. I Made It Print 12,407 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 576 Calories 30g Fat 30g Carbs 44g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 6 Calories 576 % Daily Value * Total Fat 30g 39% Saturated Fat 12g 60% Cholesterol 132mg 44% Sodium 542mg 24% Total Carbohydrate 30g 11% Dietary Fiber 4g 16% Total Sugars 4g Protein 44g 88% Vitamin C 26mg 29% Calcium 57mg 4% Iron 6mg 31% Potassium 1187mg 25% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Slow Cooker Beef Stew 01 of 434 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS 02 of 434 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/12/2025 I’m not sure what size crockpot was used for this recipe but for my crockpot, I had to use like 3 cups of beef broth for it to cover everything. 03 of 434 Photo by  sexy rebel 02/11/2025 Easy to follow This is my very first time using a slow cooker and making this delicious, easy dish. I'm so proud of myself and I know that my grandmother would be too.❤️ 04 of 434 Photo by  SaucyScone6518 11/22/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow My husband thought there wasn't enough liquid. However, my mom's stews were always thick and hearty. This was like my mom's.I added extra potatoes and some green beans (one of the few vegetables my husband will eat). 05 of 434 Photo by  Jennifer Bentley Wenning 07/12/2024 Family favorite We love this stew and I make just a few changes for our taste. One- to 1 1/2 lbs. of stew meat is enough for us. I omit the celery and add peas. I add a packet of stew seasoning and a packet of brown gravy mix. I bump up the Worcestershire sauce to a tablespoon.I use 2 small bags of golden potatoes.This stew is thick and flavorful. 06 of 434 Photo by  PuffySoda6425 01/14/2024 I made this recipe verbatim. It is cold and icy outside and I dashed out to get a chuck roast last night before the hard freeze. PERFECT. I added frozen peas and carrots at the end. Lovely! I have a smaller slow cooker, and it was done on low in 6 hours. 07 of 434 Photo by  BriefCarp1811 01/09/2024 So good. I added more beef broth and browned the beef for 45 seconds or so on each side. I canalized the onions and cooked the carrots for a few minutes with them before putting in the crock pot. I did add a beef stew seasoning packet about half way through. Absolutely delicious. 08 of 434 Photo by  LushSage7850 01/08/2024 Simple, inexpensive and feeds everyone! This is a wonderful comfort food! 09 of 434 Photo by  James 12/27/2023 I did make a beef stock from Minor's Beef Paste and added some Gravy Master. To thicken sauce I used instant Potatoe mixture. I did add other vegetables I had on hand. 10 of 434 Photo by  jheni77 12/25/2023 Easy recipe and no leftovers!
